113131.content:
Before she even knew it, Ayame from Ichiraku Ramen was sitting behind the Hokage's desk, looking attentively at the papers scattered all over. She wore the traditional Hokage garb, with the hat placed on the right side of the desk.

Tsunade looked at Ayame with a small amount of glee, then looked down at herself. She only visited Ichiraku Ramen on occasion, so she barely recognized the clothes she was wearing as the waitress uniform for the establishment. She felt her head, confirming that a rag had been tied around her hair.

"Ah, Miss Tsunade. Do you have the shipment of ramen I ordered?" Ayame asked, looking up from the papers.

Remembering having requested Ichiraku Ramen to make ramen for the hospital, Tsunade looked at the floor and saw a large container of ramen behind the door. "Yes, I did, Lady Hokage," Tsunade replied, happy she could call someone else Hokage.

"In that case, please deliver it to the hospital," Ayame said in a polite tone. "The staff has been running low and needs their supply replenished immediately."

"No problem, Lady Hokage!" Tsunade said as she lifted the large box and walked toward the hospital, leaving the teenage girl to deal with the mountain of paperwork.

After completing her delivery, Tsunade walked down the street toward the direction of Ichiraku Ramen. "Finally, free of the damn paperwork! Free of Shizune nagging at me to set an example! Free of that huge burden breaking my back!"

She arrived in front of the establishment where she now worked, just in time for her new boss Teuchi to appear from behind the counter and say, "Ah, Tsunade, there you are. Did you make that delivery?"

"Yes, sir!" Tsunade said. "I checked in with Lady Hokage first, then made the delivery."

"Good, now get ready; we're about to get the dinner crowd in soon. Be sure we have enough to feed everyone, especially Naruto."

"Yes, sir," Tsunade said, going to the back.

Tsunade checked the inventory, all the while thinking, "I'm lucky I decided to give Ayame my jutsu and medical knowledge to get her knowledge and skills at this job; I don't think I'll survive this shift without it."

For an hour, Tsunade prepared ramen and waited tables outside the main building. All this was on top of washing dishes, sweeping the dirt away from the eating areas and running deliveries that were requested of Ichiraku Ramen. Despite the work load, Tsunade kept her smile.

"It's not like I didn't expect a lot of work," Tsunade thought. "Besides, this is nothing compared to sifting through the same paperwork day after day."

113131112222121122.content:
Tsunade was washing dishes. In the blink of an eye, it seemed as if she had been surrounded by a soft light. She dismissed it as a gleam of the dish, as she began musing over her life and this night.

Born into the famed Uzumaki clan, Tsunade had been teased as a child for wanting to become the first female Hokage. She decided to face the problem head-on and quickly garnered respect for her incredible skill and unique ninjutsu style.

In time she learned of her legacy, and how her chakra would lead her to be chosen as the jinchūriki of the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox. The pain of this dark burden was greatly helped when she fell in love with Minato Namikaze, a fellow student who rescued her during a kidnapping. They grew up and eventually conceived a child: Naruto.

Sadly, the night of Naruto's birth had been a tragic one. Evil forces had forced the release of the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox from Tsunade's body, and Minato and Tsunade fought to protect their child. Minato sacrificed his life to seal the Fox inside Naruto's body. Tsunade would surely have died as well, had not the expert Medic-nin Kushina appeared. Kushina's medical jutsu saved Tsunade's life, but at the cost of Kushina's own. It was a sacrifice Tsunade still remembered after all these years, even though it had never occurred until the Exchanger had made it so.

Minato had been the Fourth Hokage, and the council felt it only right that Tsunade replace him, becoming the Fifth Hokage. Sadly, the reality had not lived up to the dream. Tsunade had hated all the paperwork involved, and losing the former Third Hokage to Orochimaru's treachery hurt all the more. As much as Naruto wanted to be Hokage, Tsunade had long ago realized that would not be the right life for him. He was meant to be a hero, not a Hokage. That was why she had reduced herself to a simple waitress at Ichiraku Ramen, one whose son apparently loved his mother's cooking very much. She hoped that these humble beginnings would help make Naruto all the more legendary in time, although for some reason she had trouble remembering what it was like to have Naruto as a son back when she was Hokage...

Still, as long as she had the Exchanger perhaps- Tsunade felt her pockets. The Exchanger wasn't there! She was sure she had pocketed it. Had it dropped out somehow? Tsunade had to search the stand. She turned to the counter and saw-
113131112222121122.title: Life Swap - Tsunade is now Tsunade Uzumaki.

She then looked over to the Dark Magician Girl card, and she could see the top of the Obelisk Blue Girls uniform in her picture. And in a poster of her whole body nest to the displayed card, she was indeed wearing the Obelisk Blue Girls uniform.

"This thing really is amazing." she thought to herself, looking down at the clothes she now wore. "I think I'll keep them for a while." she said as she straightened out her new hat.

Walking back over to her new friends, she wasn't surprised that they didn't seem to find her sudden change of close odd. After all, she assume that to everyone else, she always dressed like this.

Eventually, the group left the school store. As they made their way, they evetually ran in the her replacement as teacher, Syrus.

"Hey Sy, hows it going?" Jaden asked.

"Busy." Syrus replied with a sigh.

"Well then why don't you take a break and hang out with us?"

"I really wish I could, but I've got a lot I need to do right now."

"Hm, Syrus is just as busy as I was." Fonda thought. "Maybe he should get a bit of time off as well." she thought, though she wasn't ready to go back to her own job just yet, and coincedentally, she saw the same girl she had swapped dorms with earlier. Once again using her device, she aimed it at Syrus and the girl, and with a simple occupation swap, Syrus was now wearing his old uniform, while the girl he had swapped with now wore the uniform that had been her own until she found this device. And of course, the rest of the group was once again oblivious to the changes. Him and Jaden were currently in the middle of a conversation, as of Syrus had been with them the whole time.

1551122222111111111.content:
As the group made their way somewhere else, Fonda was trying to think of what to do next with her device. "Hm, whats another way I can have some fun with this device that I haven't tried yet?" she wondered to herself. As contemplated what to do next, she looked over to her friends.

Jaden was talking with Syrus and Hassleberry, Alexis was talking with Mindy and Jasmine though the two would pause occasionally to take note of any cute boys that they passed, Chaz was keeping to himself, and Blair was following close by Jaden as she crushed on him.

It was then when she had a sudden idea. "Ah, that would certainly be amusing." Fonda thought, and then using the device, she performed a few swaps amongst the group. After she was done, she observed the effects.

Syrus and Chazz were currently staring at a boy that was walking by. "Hes pretty cute." Syrus said, also speaking with a different tone than normal.

"Yeah, I'll say." Chazz agreed, and the two sighed longingly.

"Geez you two, do you always have to ." Jaden said as he shook his head at the two. His posture, as well as the other two boys, was noticably more feminine.

"Of course we do." Syrus said with a feminine giggle. "Maybe you should join us?"

"I think I'll pass."

With Alexis, she was talking with Mindy and Blair. "And then I made this sweet comeback once I activated my trap card!" she said, recounting a durl for them.

"Sounds great, sarge." Blair said, now speaking with an accent similar to Hassleberry's.

"Yeah, it definitely does. Wish I could have watched the duel." Mindy said.

"It was there. It wasn't anything special." Jasmine remarked as she aproached the three. "I could have done better."

"Oh, be quiet, Jasmine." Jaden said, as he walked over to them. "No one wants to hear your usual remarks right now

"Oh, come on Jaden, don't say that." Jasmine said with a blush as he walked over to them.

Alexis, having ignored the brief exchange was just finishing up her story. "...and thats how I won the duel!"

"Alexis, you're the best!" Hassleberry said, with his voice now lacking his normal accent.

With the device, she had swapped the personalties of her new friends. Jaden with Alexis, Syrus with Mindy, Chazz with Jasmine, and Hassleberry with Blair. And the results were quite amusing, from Chazz and Syrus acting boy crazy, and Jasmine having a crush on Jaden in place of Chazz's crush on Alexis, or Hasleberry's crush on Alexis in place of Blair's crush on Jaden.

All in all, she wanted to observe more from them like this. She was definitely going to leave them like this for quite a while. Now, what was she going to do them next?

Alexis and Jasmine were now in Slifer Red, Mindy and Blair were in Ra Yellow, while Hassleberry was now in Blair's place of being the sole member of Slifer Red Girls and Jaden, Syrus, and Chazz were now in the Obelisk Blue Girls dorm.

"There we go. Now everyone's in the dorm of the person they swapped personalities with." she thought. She then decided that she would take a break from swapping them around so that she could observe them like this for a while. She'd still do some swaps, just not on them for now.

A huge crash shook Sternbild City as the supposed meteor crashed to the ground. The impact left a large crater, but it didn't break through the upper layer of the city's structure.

"The meteor has landed and the portal in the sky has suddenly vanished! It looks like the impact didn't make it through the upper layer of the city, but this is still a dangerous situation. What does this mean for...hold on! It looks like someone is approaching the site of the meteor!"

1553321111.content:
"...and it looks like the first hero on the scene is Wild Tiger!"

Kotetsu T. Kaburagi, aka Wild Tiger, walked down to the bottom of the crater, having been disturbed from a lunch with his daughter. "That's odd; we don't usually get meteors falling around here. I should make sure there's no damage and get back; I don't want Kaede to get mad at me again for skipping out on her."

Kotetsu was at the center of the crater now, when he said, "What the hell is this thing supposed to be?" He then picked up the strange metallic ball off the ground. No sooner than he did did he become imbued with all knowledge of the device called the Exchanger. "A device that can make me switch anything between two people? What a load of crap! Who'd ever believe--"

"Tiger, come in! Do you read me?" Kotetsu heard Agnes Joubert, the producer of Hero TV, say over the intercom in his suit.

"Yeah, read you loud and clear!"

"Good, what can you tell me about the meteor?"

"Don't worry about it. Sure there's a giant hole in the ground now, but there seems to be no casualties nor any major damage to any important pipes and wires."

"Good. I'll relay it to the news team. In the meantime, I've just received word that a NEXT is wreaking havoc nearby. Get over there and stop him."

"What? But my daughter's in town and I wanted to--"

"Are you questioning me, Tiger?"

*sigh* "No, of course not."

"Good, now get over there!"

"Fine, I get it, already!" Kotetsu screamed before he cut the communications link. "Geez, she's such a slave driver. I bet she would be so demanding of us if she knew what it was like to be a hero."

All of a sudden, Kotetsu heard the Exchanger whir in his hands. "What the--" he started to say, but the Exchanger covered the area in a blinding light before he could voice his thoughts any further. When the light faded, Kotetsu saw...
1553321111.title: Wild Tiger and the Exchanger

Then, following the directions Agnes left him, Kotetsu made his way to a bank that was being robbed by the NEXT she mentioned. As Kotetsu made his way to the next, he began to say, "Hey, you there! You shouldn't be--"

"Hold it right there, criminal!"

Kotetsu was surprised to hear the voice so suddenly...and without the comm link. Looking up, he confirmed his suspicions that it was Agnes Joubert who had said it, but she was wearing the costume of one of the heroes!

Agnes stood in a seductive pose as she addressed the thief, allowing Blue Rose's skimpy costume to accentuate her curves. She had even dyed her hair blue and wore icy blue lipstick and eye shadow. In one hand, she held one of the guns Blue Rose typically used to fire ice beams.

"Sorry, but no lady's gonna pin me down," the NEXT thief responded as he activated his powers and started running in circles around her. Eventually, he disappeared in a blur as he continued to increase in speed.

"Hey, leave her alone!" Kotetsu cried as he ran toward the thief. However, he was being repelled back by an unseen force.

"Like that? My NEXT powers give me super-speed, so none of you worthless heroes can catch me! By the time I'm done, this chick's gonna be blue in the face, and I don't mean just her makeup!"

"You talk too much," Agnes replied as she fired her gun, freezing the ground around her. The thief slipped on the now frozen ground and slid headfirst into a building, knocking him out instantly. To make extra sure he couldn't escape, she then froze his legs, arms and torso to the building and ground. To finish, Agnes struck another seductive pose and said, "My ice may be a little cold, but your crime has been completely put on hold!"

"And another chilling arrest for Blue Rose!" Kotetsu heard the announcer say. He decided to hang back and watch the crowd reactions. As with the thief and announcer, everybody thought it was perfectly normal that Agnes was now Blue Rose.

After the crowds died out, Kotetsu saw Agnes walking toward Blue Rose's trailer. He decided to sneak in and saw that Agnes...

15533211112212.content:
Agnes was now standing in front of a large screen looking at footage from the last broadcast. "What the hell happened here?" she yelled into her bluetooth headset.

"What do you mean?" another voice responded.

"The camera was supposed to show off my gun-firing pose when I froze the criminal to the wall. I can't believe you are this incompetent when it comes to setting up show-stealing shots. Honestly, I don't know how this show would survive if I wasn't producing it."

"Why are you producing the show, anyway?" Kotetsu asked, startling Agnes with his presence. "Shouldn't you focus more on saving people's lives?"

"Not that it's any of your business, but I majored in broadcasting in college, so I wanted to be involved in TV in any way I could. As soon as I was approached to be on HeroTV, I jumped at the chance to produce, even if I do have to serve as one of the heroes in the process."

"How do you juggle that much responsibility?"

"It's easy; when I'm out on the field, I simply focus on two things: 1. the safety of the people around me; 2. always expecting the camera on me."

"So why are you so obsessed with showing off your body?"

"The Blue Rose's main selling point is her sexuality. Trust me, I wouldn't act like a superpowered bimbo if it wasn't necessary."

Kotetsu left after that, thinking, "Whoa; I can't believe this Exchanger thing works! I wonder what else I can do with this!"

info.brief_description: A strange item called the Exchanger comes to anime worlds and starts changing everything.
info.description:
The Exchanger takes the shape of a metal ball with a built-in button on top and two small eye-like lenses. Once in a character's possession, the character will be given all knowledge of the Exchanger and will be the only one able to see anything out of the ordinary in the new world the Exchanger will create.

The Exchanger's primary function is to exchange a particular trait between two or more people (including the one in possession of the Exchanger, but this person doesn't always have to be involved) and alter reality to make the exchanges seem natural. Examples of such swaps include:

Body
